markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Poracha Fulu](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2040)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=36" />
<trait label="Fulu" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=378" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Talisman" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=155" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 78 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Price** 30 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** affixed to armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Folklore from near the Forest of Spirits tells of the origin of the _poracha fulu_. Once, a traveler saved an eight-legged feline who turned out to be a [poracha](/Monsters.aspx?ID=335) prince. In return, the prince gave the traveler a fulu that later prevented a fast-acting poison from slaying them. Traditionally, one wears a string of up to nine _poracha fulus_, which counts as one talisman. Each time you take [persistent damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29), one poracha fulu affixed to you negates the damage and crumbles to dust. This response is automatic, but you can use a free action (envision) to prevent your fulus from responding. If you do, any poracha fulus affixed to you never respond to that persistent damage.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Poracha Fulu

text: <title level="1" right="Item 5" pfs="Standard" > Poracha Fulu Source Treasure Vault pg. 78 1.1 Price 30 gp Usage affixed to armor --- Folklore from near the Forest of Spirits tells of the origin of the poracha fulu . Once, a traveler saved an eight-legged feline who turned out to be a poracha prince. In return, the prince gave the traveler a fulu that later prevented a fast-acting poison from slaying them. Traditionally, one wears a string of up to nine poracha fulus , which counts as one talisman. Each time you take persistent damage, one poracha fulu affixed to you negates the damage and crumbles to dust. This response is automatic, but you can use a free action (envision) to prevent your fulus from responding. If you do, any poracha fulus affixed to you never respond to that persistent damage.
